clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of SPC on Advanced Breast Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Specialist Palliative Care on the Exacerbation of Negative Symptoms, Life Quality and Performance Status of Patients With Advanced Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this prospective, observational study is the evaluation of the effectiveness of a 14-day Specialist Palliative Care therapy in participants with advanced breast cancer carried out in a stationary palliative care unit in Poland. The length of the entire study will be 36 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Variation of intensification of patients negative symptoms before and after SPC
primary_outcome.description: intensification of patients negative symptoms was assessed by Edmonton Symptom Assessment System (esas)

primary_outcome.measure: Variation of performance status of patients before and after SPC
primary_outcome.description: performance status of patients was assessed by ECOG scale (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group)

primary_outcome.measure: Variation of quality of life of patients before and after SPC
primary_outcome.description: quality of life of patients of patients was assessed by quality of life uniscale (QoLU)

intervention.description: In the research, Specialist Palliative Care was provided according to the guidelines established by Mid-Western Health Board in a Report of the National Advisory Committee on Palliative Care as well as according to recommendations of Polish Society of Palliative Medicine and Polish National Healthcare Fund. In order to ensure interdisciplinary and integrated palliative care, a team of specialists was appointed. Team members were engaged in the process of treatment of each patient during the time of the study and applied their specialist skills according to the needs of the patients
